SEARCH
Package org.lockout

Class Dbops

java.lang.Object
org.lockout.Dbops
public class Dbops extends Object
All database calls here. Some static parts also for connecting to the database, initialised at Lambda startup.

  • Field Details

    • ddbclient

      static software.amazon.awssdk.services.dynamodb.DynamoDbClient ddbclient
      The old dyanamoDB client. Still Required to create the enhanced client. Actually used for some parts, not everything can be done with the enhanced client (Or I did not manage to figure out how yet)

    • ddbeclient

      static software.amazon.awssdk.enhanced.dynamodb.DynamoDbEnhancedClient ddbeclient
      The enhanced dynamoDb client, makes some parts easier.

  • Method Details

    • InitDdbModel

      public static void InitDdbModel()

    • CreateActualTableIfNeeded

      public static void CreateActualTableIfNeeded()
      Creates DynamoDb table if it does not already exist. TODO: I should probably remove this function completely ? I suppose it is wasting time.

    • getUser

      public static Data getUser(User user) throws Exception
      Just take the whole user out of the database at return. Authentication and stuff is not our responsibility here. Assuming most users are going to be authenticated, not a bad idea to extract the whole row at once, maybe I am mistaken.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to get with whatever email he/she claims he/she is.
      Returns:
      The whole row of data corresponding to the user.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • updateUserInfo

      public static void updateUserInfo(User user) throws Exception
      Modifies the user. Any validations/safety are not the responsibility here. Take the given User, and send the whole thing to DB. Full row replacement.
      Parameters:
      user - the user object to. Note that this object contains the "Data" field for the user. (assuming they were correctly authenticated, otherwise it would be null but this call will never be made for an unauthenticated user)
      Throws:
      Exception - if for some reason it turns out that the user we are trying to update does not even exist.

    • updateUserSession

      public static void updateUserSession(User user, String sessionToken) throws Exception
      Updates the session information (sessionToken and sessiontime) Called on every login basically. Independently takes the current time just at the time of making change in db while the session token is provided by the caller.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose session has to be updated.
      sessionToken - The random id generated for the cookie token.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the user somehow doesn't exist or something.

    • makeUser

      public static void makeUser(User user, String sessiontoken) throws Exception
      Create a new user in database. Be very careful, this function doesn't check if user already exists, the caller has to check that with the getUser(User) method. In case of mishap, the entire user data will get emptied for this user.
      Parameters:
      user -
      sessiontoken -
      Throws:
      Exception
